meanings.def: a group of things of the same type that grow or appear close together
examples: The telescope is focused on a dense cluster of stars at the edge of the galaxy.
The plant bears its flowers in clusters.
a leukaemia cluster (= an area where there are more cases of the disease than you would expect)
Doctors are worried about what appear to be cancer clusters occurring in these areas.
The bacteria form clusters in the gut of the host animal.
The plants have clusters of white flowers in early June.

meanings.def: a group of people, animals or things close together
examples: The church stood in a small cluster of houses.
A woman had emerged from the cluster of buildings.

meanings.def: a group of consonants that come together in a word or phrase, for example /str/ at the beginning of string
to come together in a small group or groups
examples: cluster together The children clustered together in the corner of the room.
cluster around/round/at somebody/something The doctors clustered anxiously around his bed.
Thatched cottages cluster round the harbour.
The children clustered around their teacher.
Guests clustered at tables scattered around the hotel's bar.
